intro: Guettarda caracasana, commonly known as the Caribbean guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Guettarda caracasana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
